result.execSummary:
The defendant Steve J. Morris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:05 a.m. Defendant Steve J. Morris in court with attorney Troy L. Nielsen.  Defendant Steve J. Morris in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of PSI. Nielsen correction to page 2 of PSI - description of events - located within 2 months. Sowinski statement on sentencing. Nielsen statement on sentencing. Defendant statement on sentencing. Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Prison - 4 years to commence immediately - CC to any other sentence
Initial confinement - 2 - 1/2 years 
Extended supervision -  2 years 
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Court finds defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. 
Appeal rights given. NADVI given. WEDS given.
Adj. 11:40 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on April 10, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on March 2, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

3:03 p.m. Defendant Steve J. Morris in court in custody with attorney Troy L. Nielsen.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf157 and 15cf146. State moves to dismiss 15cf157 without prejudice - Granted. In 15cf146 - State moves to dimiss but read-in Count 1 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 2 in 15cf146. Victim rights legislation complied.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Parties agree to obtain PSI.  PSI to be completed by 01-24-17; author need not appear at hearing. Bail continued. Adj. 3:08 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 31, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Steve J. Morris in court with attorney Troy L. Nielsen.  Defendant Steve J. Morris in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:46
Calling 15cf157 and 15cf146
Sowinski statement - has initiated some further investigation -  Victim's mother in court - would request adjournment but if court is not willing to adjourn, would continue with previous offer/agreement reached - PSI would still be requested
Nielsen statement - agrees to Adjournment -
Bail continued  Plea hearing scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
again refused to sign amended bond

Defendant Steve J. Morris in court with attorney Troy Louis Nielsen.  Defendant Steve J. Morris in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:26
Calling 15cf146 and 15cf157
State moves to dismiss 15cf157 in its entirety - gives statement to reasons dismissing on record - Victim rights compliance has been met - Court statement - Court will not accept dismissal motion at this time - Would like victim/mother of victim to speak - Sowinski statement to protection of victims - Court statement - Court can make closed hearing (Except media, which are advised to withhold victim information)  Nielsen statement - 
Sowinski statement to bail - Request bond be continued and add no contact WHATSOEVER  both child vicitims/ BMK, BLK and any family members - Court grants - Amended bond done on 15cf146 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Includes 15cf157 - No contact WHATSOEVER with BMK or BALK or their families
Includes 15cf157 - No contact with victims named in either complaint - BMK or BALK

Defendant Steven J. Morris in court with attorney Troy Louis Nielsen.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:40
Calling 15cf146 and 15cf157 - Both set for initial/prelim and arraignments - 
Sowinski statement to status of cases - In receipt of both complaints, waive readings - 
  Defendant waives preliminary hearings. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over on both cases - 
Informations filed-  waive readings - not guilty plea plea entered at this time- 
Sowinski to bail - Nielsen statement - defendant on prison sentence - Court sets $  sig bond - both cases  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Initial appearance on July 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on July 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.
